# Skills

A repository for AI skills, intended for use in general purpose projects.

## Available Skills

- **[rspec-gary](skills/rspec-gary/)** - RSpec testing guidelines following the GARY principle (Go Ahead, Repeat Yourself)
- **[rails-delegated-roles](skills/rails-delegated-roles/)** - Use `delegated_type` for role delegation instead of the Blob anti-pattern

## Installation

### Via Claude Code

```bash
/plugin marketplace add scottmatthewman/skills
```

Then install the plugin:

```bash
/plugin install scottmatthewman-skills
```

### Via [skills.sh](https://skills.sh)

```bash
npx skills add scottmatthewman/skills
```

### Manual Installation

Copy the `SKILL.md` file from any skill directory into your project's `.claude/skills/` directory.

# rspec-gary

An AI skill for writing readable RSpec tests using the GARY principle: **Go Ahead, Repeat Yourself**.

## What is this?

This skill provides guidelines for AI coding assistants when writing RSpec tests. It encourages inline setup, clear variable naming, and self-contained tests over DRY abstractions that sacrifice readability.

## Attribution

This is based on a lightning talk I gave in February 2024 at [LRUG](https://lrug.org/meetings/2024/february/).

> **Be More GARY: How to up your RSpec Game**
> 
> Elevate your RSpec tests by questioning common DRY practices. Enter the GARY method, 
> where strategic repetition enhances test clarity and maintainability. Resist premature
> refactoring and convoluted logic, leaving yourself with clearer tests that document
> your code. Go ahead, repeat yourself

- [**Presentation video**](https://assets.lrug.org/videos/2024/february/scott-matthewman-be-more-gary-how-to-up-your-rspec-game-lrug-feb-2024.mp4)
- [**Blog post**](https://scottm.medium.com/be-more-gary-upping-your-rspec-game-56ce4f15029e)

## Usage

Install via [skills.sh](https://skills.sh) or copy `SKILL.md` to your project's skills directory.

## Files

- `SKILL.md` - The skill definition (consumed by AI agents)
- `README.md` - This file (human documentation)

# rails-delegated-roles

An AI skill for implementing role delegation in Rails using `delegated_type` instead of the Blob anti-pattern.

## What is this?

This skill provides guidelines for AI coding assistants when implementing user roles in Rails applications. It teaches
the use of `delegated_type` (Rails 6.1+) to create type-safe domain models where each role is its own model with its
own table, associations, and validations.

## Attribution

This is based on a lightning talk I gave at [LRUG](https://lrug.org/meetings/2026/february/) in 2026.

> **The Blob Must Die!**
>
> How we destroyed a 1,400-line User model using Rails' `delegated_type` and
> metaprogramming. When roles have their own data and associations, they deserve
> their own models.

## Usage

Install via [skills.sh](https://skills.sh) or copy `SKILL.md` to your project's skills directory.

## Files

- `SKILL.md` - The skill definition (consumed by AI agents)
- `README.md` - This file (human documentation)
